intro: Argostemma viscidum, commonly known as sticky argostemma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including India and China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy, often sticky stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its small, tubular flowers are typically white or pale yellow and are arranged in clusters. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
